phosphorus_deficiency.title: Phosphorus Deficiency Detected
recommendations: Your maize is showing signs of phosphorus deficiency. Here are some remedies:
Apply a phosphorus-rich fertilizer. Look for fertilizers with a high middle number (P) in the N-P-K ratio.
Incorporate bone meal or rock phosphate into the soil. These are excellent organic sources of phosphorus.
Ensure your soil pH is between 6.0 and 7.0. Phosphorus is most available to plants in this range.
Compost and manure can also help to increase phosphorus levels in the soil over time.
